long_description:
Winter is in full swing, and though spring is officially arriving in a month or so, this corner of the world still has a long way to go before the sunny days warm us up. Luckily, we’ve a little secret to share with you that will completely change your winter in New York…

 

The Royalton New York Hotel is not only an iconic and elegant hotel in the heart of New York, we’re also the only hotel in the five boroughs that has real, wood-burning fireplaces. As long as the temperature is in the low 40°F or less, you’ll be able to call the front desk and request to have your fireplace lit.

 

But we also know you probably don’t want to be hibernating in your room during your entire stay, so here are our top suggestions for making the most of the icy weather before heading back to your room at the Royalton New York.

 

 

By far the best way to get warm is to get your blood pumping. A stroll in Central Park never gets old, regardless of how many times you’ve come to New York. You might know your favorite pathways and the shortcuts to avoid the most crowded parts, but why not add a little bit of insider’s knowledge to your repertoire.

 

Central Park Conservancy offers official tours, guided or self-guided. You can choose anything from Central Park’s highlights, to its hidden gems, such as The North Woods and Hallett Nature Sanctuary.  

 

While you’re in that part of town, ice-skating is always an option -  Wollman Rink in Central Park is open until April 1st. Other options are the rink at Bryant Park, open until March 4, or The Rink in Rockefeller Center, open until April 15. Now that the holiday season is over, you can take advantage of fewer crowds in Rockefeller Center and book exclusive ice-skating experiences. Some options include an afternoon tea & skating package, après skate (cocktails and nibbles) or starlight skate, which guarantees admission to the last skating session of the day.

 

Whatever you choose, end the day in your cozy room at the Royalton New York, aka your sanctum sanctorum in New York. Check out our special offers and book your room today.
